Step 1: firstly, heat oil and roast soya chaap sticks both the sides. keep aside.

 Step 2:now saute in cumin and bay leaf till it turns aromatic.

 Step 3:furthermore, add in onions and saute well.

 Step 4:additionally, add in ginger-garlic paste and saute.

 Step 5:now add in tomato pulp.

 Step 6:stir continuously till the tomato pulp thickens up and releases oil.

 Step 7:furthermore add in turmeric, chilli powder, coriander powder, cumin powder and salt.

 Step 8:add in water and cream.

 Step 9:keeping the flame on low stir continuously.

 Step 10:further add in roasted soya bean chaap sticks into the curry.

 Step 11:cover and simmer for 15 minutes.

 Step 12:now add in garam masala, crushed kasuri methi and coriander leaves.

 Step 13:finally, serve soya chaap curry along with rice, roti or chapathi.
